name: Easy Fractured Quizzyland Subcategories | Brain Teasers | 20 Questions

questions.text: Why old Mom mulls? (This is a subcategory under Animals.)
questions.explanation:
wild mammals.

	Sub-subcategories under Wild Mammals include Cetaceans and Sireneans; Lagomorphs; and Marsupials and Monotremes.

questions.text: Were dip lei? (This is a subcategory under Brain Teasers.)
questions.explanation:
word play.

	Sub-subcategories under Word Play include Anagrams, Crytograms, Rebuses, and Spoonerisms.

questions.text: Fill loss suffers send sigh college jests? (This is a subcategory under People.)
questions.explanation:
Philosophers and Psychologists.

	There are two sub-subcategories: Philosophers and Psychologists & Sociologists.

questions.text: You knight Ted's dates? (This is a subcategory under Geography.)
questions.explanation:
United States.

	Under United States, you can find quizzes on most of the 50 states, from Alabama to Wyoming.

questions.text: Sir cusses sin fey hearse? (This is a subcategory under Entertainment.)
questions.explanation:
Circuses and Fairs.

	In this subcategory you can find quizzes about acrobats, clowns, circus freaks, and the Cirque de Soleil.

questions.text: Here's another one under Entertainment: Pew tea patch chintz?
questions.explanation:
Beauty Pageants.

	Quizzes on such contests as Miss America, Miss Universe, and Miss World are found here.

questions.text: Here's a subcategory under General Knowledge: Jimpson burst owns?
questions.explanation:
Gems and Birthstones.

	A treasure trove of quizzes on diamonds, rubies, emeralds, sapphires, and more.

questions.text: This one is under Hobbies: Faux dog gruff fee?
questions.explanation:
photography.

	Other subcategories under Hobbies include Astrology, Crafts, Needlework, Weapons, and--my favorite--Food and Drink.

questions.text: This one's under History: Oh she yay knee awe?
questions.explanation:
Oceania.

	Quizzes about Australia, New Zealand, the Pacific Islands, and Papua New Guinea.

questions.text: This one is under Humanities (but that doesn't tell you much): Ms. Elaine knee yes?
questions.explanation:
Miscellaneous.

	Other subcategories under Humanities include Architecture, Linguistics, and Theatre.

questions.text: This one is under Literature: Sheiks pier?
questions.explanation:
Shakespeare.

	Here you'll find comedies, tragedies, and histories galore.

questions.text: This one is under People: Crummy knolls?
questions.explanation:
Criminals.

	The list of jolly sub-subcategories includes Assassinations; Kids Who Kill; and Mass and Spree Killers.

questions.text: This one is under Music: Leer Rick's Mig stir?
questions.explanation:
Lyrics Mixture.

	Sub-subcategories include First Lines of Songs, Last Lines of Songs, Nonsense Lyrics, and Who Sang This?

questions.text: This subcategory is under Religion: Judy is him?
questions.explanation:
Judaism.

	Here you'll find quizzes on Jewish traditions, beliefs, and holidays such as Hannukkah, Passover, Purim, and Yom Kippur.

questions.text: This is a subcategory under World: Millie Terry madders?
questions.explanation:
Military Matters.

	These are quizzes on various branches of the armed services (in various nations).

questions.text: Another one under World: Lung witches?
questions.explanation:
Languages.

	There are sub-subcategories for languages from Afrikaans to Welsh.

questions.text: Here's one under Sci/Tech: Fizz six?
questions.explanation:
Physics.

	Here, scientifically minded players will find quizzes on subatomic particles, quantum mechanics, and thermodynamics.

questions.text: And one under Brain Teasers: Lodge hick pus hulls?
questions.explanation:
Logic Puzzles.

	This subcategory includes a large percentage of quizzes labeled "Impossible."

questions.text: A subcategory under Sports: Oh limp peck gay hums?
questions.explanation:
Olympic Games.

	There are sub-subcategories on Summer Games, Winter Games, and Olympic History.

questions.text: And another one under Sports: I soggy?
questions.explanation:
Ice Hockey.

	This subcategory has many different sub-subs on the NHL, one for ice hockey in the UK, and a sub-subcategory on ice hockey in the "Rest of the World."
